detaileddescription.para: 10ms timers

Start value for "KL15 timer for driving cycle" - 2 seconds
values 200u
100ms timers

Start value for "Speed validation timer" - 2 seconds
values 20u
Start value for T_NM_DiagActive

Start value for "T_NM_DiagActive" after diagnosis requests and responses - 4 seconds
values 40u
Start value for T_NM_DiagActive

Start value for "T_NM_DiagActive" after Transition35 - 40 seconds
values 400u
Start value for T_Diag_Enable

Start value for "T_Diag_Enable" at KL15_OFF and activation of the DefaultSession after start-up - 60 seconds
values 600u
Start value for T_Diag_Enable

Start value for "T_Diag_Enable" at ransition from KL15_ON to KL15_OFF - 900 seconds (15 min)
values 9000u
Timer expiry

Value for timer expired (Count down timers)
values 0u
TESTER_PRESENT

Service ID (SID) for the diagnosis service TesterPresent (3Ehex)
values 0x3Eu
LAST_OBD_SERVICE_REQUEST_ID

"T_NM_DiagActive" shall not be (re)started due to diagnosis requests with service ID 01hex - 0Fhex (ScanToolServices) - Last SID of ScanToolServices
values 0x0Fu
FUNCTIONAL_REQUEST

Used for a functional diagnosis request
values DCM_NORMAL_FUNCTIONAL_REQUEST
PRESCALLER_100MS

Prescaler to scale down from a 10 ms cyclic processing to a 100 ms processing
values 9u
K_DIAG_PRECOND_MIN_VEHICLE_SPEED

Velocity limit used for vehicle speed validation - 5 km/h
values 500u
K_DIAG_PRECOND_MAX_VEHICLE_SPEED

Velocity limit used for vehicle speed validation - 655,33 km/h
values 65533u
The "si_Diagnose_Activ timer" value

"si_Diagnose_Activ timer" is processed cyclically every 10 ms. The timer shall be (re)started when diagnostic messages (CAN/100BaseTx) are received and thus a diagnostic is active.
As long as this timer is running Chorus shall set the signal Systeminfo_01.SI_Diagnose_Aktiv = 1. If the timer is expired Chorus shall set the signal Systeminfo_01.SI_Diagnose_Aktiv = 0.
This timer variable is a global variable and exported to be used by DoIP_DCM, RoutingTask, GwAdaptor, WakeupSleep SW Units.
range 0 - 400 unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
This struct variable contains the "KL15 timer for driving cycle" and it's status

"KL15 timer for driving cycle" is processed cyclically every 10 ms.
This timer is used to count the 2 s time for the following requirement related to evaluation of a qualified Driving Cycle (DCY), see SWR_ICAS1_Diag_791: "CRoute shall evaluate status information of DCY only when KL15 = ON for at least 2 seconds."
The struct element "Status" holds the result of the last cyclic processing (ELAPSED, RUNNING, STOPPED, RESTARTED) and the struct element "Value" holds the (DRIVING_CYCLE_TIMER_START_VALUE) is a 10ms timer, and is provided to the DCY processing software part via the export function "getStateKL15TimerForDrivingCycle".
range struct{value(0 - 200), Timer state(0 - 3) unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
This struct variable contains the validation status of vehicle speed processing and a timer that is used for the processing.

Some diagnosis services require as one of the preconditions to be fulfilled in order to allow their execution that the velocity (vehicle speed) is within a certain range. This variable contains in the struct element "si_Status" holds the result of this velocity precondition check (FAILED or PASSED) and struct element "TimerValue" holds the 100ms timer (SPEED_VALIDATION_TIMER). After wakeup the status shall be set to FAILED.
The 2nd struct element "TimerValue" is a timer and is used to implement the 2 seconds counting of the following requirement (see SWR_ICAS1_Diag_118): The status shall change from PASSED to FAILED if the velocity conditions are not fulfilled for a time longer than 2 seconds
range struct{ConditionVehicleSpeed(0 - 1), TimerValue(0 - 20) unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
The "T_NM_DiagActive" timer

"T_NM_DiagActive" timer is processed cyclically every 100 ms. This timer is used to control the "NM_DiagActive" bit, which indicates towards the network management (NM) the wish to stay awake due to a running diagnosis communication.
"T_NM_DiagActive" shall be stopped when switching from the Default to a NonDefaultSession. It shall be started or retriggered for all diagnosis requests and responses within the DefaultSession (exept for SID = TesterPresent (3Ehex) and SID = 01hex - 0Fhex (ScanToolServices))
The "NM_DiagActive" bit shall be set to 1 under the following conditions
during a NonDefaultSession
during a DefaultSession with a running timer "T_NM_DiagActive"
range 0 - 400 unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
The "T_Diag_Enable" timer

"T_Diag_Enable" timer is processed cyclically every 100 ms. This timer is used to force the suppression of diagnostic communication in the case of no further internal server reasons for maintaining diagnostic activity. Background is to prevent a "endless" diagnosis communciation at Kl.15 off in order to save energy in the car.
This timer controls the bool variable "DiagEnableStatus" which is set to FALSE if the timer expired (AND no diagnosis requests/responses are (still) processed). With "DiagEnableStatus" == FALSE the "T_NM_DiagActive" timer will not be retriggered and thus the wish towards the network managment (NM) to stay awake due to a running diagnosis communication will be withdrawn after "T_NM_DiagActive" elapsed.
"T_Diag_Enable" shall be stopped when switching from the Default to a NonDefaultSession. It shall be (re)started at
Transition from KL15_ON to KL15_OFF
KL15_OFF and activation of the DefaultSession after start-up
range 0 - 9000 unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
Holds the information if diagnosis is active during a DefaultSession .

It takes the diagnosis activation status as passed to component DiagnosticTimers by the function "DiagnosticTimersNotifyDiagnoseActiveStatus" as long as the following conditions are true
DefaultSession is running
The functionally addressed TesterPresent service (SID 3Ehex) is NOT running
No SID out of range 01hex - 0Fhex (ScanToolServices) is running
range TRUE,FALSE unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context

Holds the information if one of the following preconditions for retriggering T_NM_DiagActive is still fulfilled:
T_Diag_Enable timer running
Diagnosis requests or responses are (still) processed

TRUE: At least one of the above mentioned preconditions is fulfilled FALSE: T_Diag_Enable elapsed AND All diagnostic requests/responses have been processed
range TRUE,FALSE unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
Holds the information if the so called Transition 35 (from a NonDefaultSession to the DefaultSession due to KL15_OFF to KL15_ON) has been processed completely.

This information is passed to this variable by the function "DiagnosticTimersNotifyTransition35" within it's parameter "TransitionProcessed": TRUE: Transition 35 has been processed FALSE: Transition 35 has not been completed
range TRUE,FALSE unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context
Holds the information if the running diagnosis session is the DefaultSession .

TRUE: Current diagnosis session is the DefaultSession FALSE: Current diagnosis session is a non DefaultSession
range TRUE,FALSE unit NA resolution NA context task protection none - used from one context

The function process RetriggerNMDiagActiveTimerOnDiagnosticRequest

This function checks if NMDiagTimer is to retrigger based on a diagnostic request from tester. NM Diag Active timer is not to retrigger if tester present was sent with suppressed response bit == functional request. Retrigger NM Diag Active timer if currently processed diagnostic request is not tester present with suppresed response and not SID 01hex - 0Fhex.

briefdescription.para: The function RetriggerSI_DiagnoseAktivTimer just sets the timer variable "SI_DiagnoseAktivTimer" to "SI_DIAGNOSEAKTIV_TIMER_START_VALUE" (400 > 4 s).

detaileddescription.para: It shall be called in order to retrigger the timer when diagnostic messages (CAN/100BaseTx) are received and thus a diagnostic is active. (see EA)

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Test if the static variable "SI_DiagnoseAktivTimer" is set to the value given in SI_DIAGNOSEAKTIV_TIMER_START_VALUE. TEST_DiagnosticTimers__RetriggerSI_DiagnoseAktivTimer

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para:
This function is given by architectural requirments: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", Interaction Diagram: "DiagnosticTimers_Retriggers" EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", StateMachine Diagram: "Timers State Machine" ??? AnMa ????: The given reference to the StateMachine Diagram: "Timers State Machine" may need to modified after EA was reworked.
It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_911; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_917; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_918; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_916}

briefdescription.para: The function DiagnosticTimersSetDefaultSessionState is called when the diagnosis session changes, for example due to request of Service "Diagnostic Session Control" (SID 10hex) by the diagnosis tester (client).

detaileddescription.para: It stores the information, if the the new diagnosis session is the DefaultSession or not, in a static variable for further use by other internal functions. This information is given via the boolean function parameter "state" by the caller of this function.

entry.para: Information if new diagnosis session is the DefaultSession
TRUE: New diagnosis session is the DefaultSession ; FALSE: New diagnosis session is a NonDefaultSession

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Test if the static variable "isDefaultSession" is set to the value of the argument passed in function parameter "state" TEST_DiagnosticTimers__DiagnosticTimersSetDefaultSessionState

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para:
This function is given by architectural requirments: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", Interaction Diagram: "DiagnosticTimers_Retriggers"
It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_866; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_864; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_863; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_856; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_873}

briefdescription.para: The function RetriggerTDiagEnableTimer just sets the timer variable "T_Diag_Enable" to "DIAG_ENABLE_TIMER_START_VALUE_ON_KL15OFF" (9000 > 900 s = 15 minutes).

detaileddescription.para: It shall be called if transition from KL15_ON to KL15_OFF is detected.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Test if the static variable "T_Diag_Enable" is set to the value given in DIAG_ENABLE_TIMER_START_VALUE_ON_KL15OFF. TEST_DiagnosticTimers__RetriggerTDiagEnableTimer

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para:
This function is given by architectural requirments: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", StateMachine Diagram: "Timers State Machine" ??? AnMa ????: Call of this interface function is not shown in any sequence chart in EA. Will this be added? The given reference to the StateMachine Diagram: "Timers State Machine" may need to modified after EA was reworked.
It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_875, SWR_ICAS1_Diag_860}

briefdescription.para: The function RetriggerNMDiagActiveTimer sets the timer T_NM_DiagActive to either 40 s or 4 s - depending on the variable "Trasition35Requested" - if the preconditions for retriggering the timer T_NM_DiagActive (as stored in the variable "DiagEnableStatus") are fulfilled.

detaileddescription.para:
It is shall be called if
a transition to the default diagnosis session happens
for all diagnosis requests and responses within the DefaultSession

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Equivalence class analysis (test of representative values from input range) TEST_DiagnosticTimers__RetriggerNMDiagActiveTimer

simplesect.title: Traceability

briefdescription.para: The function DiagnosticTimersNotifyDiagnoseActiveStatus is called due to the so called "Transition 35".

detaileddescription.para: "Transition 35" = Change from NonDefaultSession to DefaultSession due to KL15_OFF to KL15_ON (see SWR_ICAS_Diag_99). In the function parameter "TransitionProcessed" the transition status is given.

entry.para: TRUE: Tansition 35 has been processed; FALSE: Transition 35 has not been completed

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Test if the static variable "Trasition35Requested" is set to the value of the argument passed in function parameter "TransitionProcessed" TEST_DiagnosticTimers__DiagnosticTimersNotifyTransition35

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para:
This function is given by architectural requirments: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", Interaction Diagram: "DiagnosticTimers_Retriggers"
It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_876; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_874}

briefdescription.para: The function DiagnosticTimersNotifyDiagnoseActiveStatus is called if the diagnosis activation status changes (becomes active and incative) and the new activation status is passed as argument in the function parameter "NewStatus".

detaileddescription.para: It checks the precondition "Default diagnosis session is active", and if it's true, it calls the function "RetriggerNMDiagActiveTimerOnDiagnosticRequest" in order to to update the timer "NM_DiagActive" and the status "DiagnosticActive" (as long as further conditions are fulfilled)

simplesect.title: Globals
simplesect.para: N/A ??? AnMa ????: Do static global variables need to be listed here? Assumption: No

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Equivalence class analysis (test of representative values from input range) TEST_DiagnosticTimers__DiagnosticTimersNotifyDiagnoseActiveStatus

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para:
This function is given by architectural requirments: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", Interaction Diagram: "DiagnosticTimers_Retriggers"
It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_864; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_863}

briefdescription.para: The function DiagnosticTimersCyclic shall be called cyclically every 10ms.

detaileddescription.para: It processes the timers "T_NM_DiagActive" and "T_Diag_Enable" as well as the related status informations every 100 ms (using a prescaler). Besides the "si_Diagnose_Activ timer" and the "KL15 timer for driving cycle" are both processed every 10 ms. The Kl.15 (change) status - as given in function parameter clamp15Change - is forwarded to the processing functions of timer "T_Diag_Enable" and "KL15 timer for driving cycle", which both are depending on Kl.15 status.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: This function can be verified using the following test method: Equivalence class analysis (test of representative values from input range) TEST_DiagnosticTimers__DiagnosticTimersCyclic

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para:
This function is given by architectural requirments: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.DiagnosticTimers.Dynamic", Interaction Diagram: "DiagnosticTimers_Cyclic"
It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_857; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_856; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_859; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_875; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_873; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_876; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_874}

briefdescription.para: The function getStateKL15TimerForDrivingCycle just returns the status of the "KL15 timer for driving cycle".

detaileddescription.para:
N/A
N/A
void
TimerState - Status of the "KL15 timer for driving cycle" which is counted every 10 ms
TIMER_ELAPSED
- Timer elapsed in the last cyclic 10 ms processing
TIMER_RUNNING
- Timer is running and decremented every 10 ms
TIMER_STOPPED
- Timer is stopped
TIMER_RESTARTED
- Timer was set to DRIVING_CYCLE_TIMER_START_VALUE (200 = 2 s) in the last cyclic 10ms processing
Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Activity diagram of the function "getStateKL15TimerForDrivingCycle"
Test Method
This function can be verified using the following test method: Test if the function returns the value of the struct element "Status" from the static struct variable "KL15TimerForDCY". TEST_DiagnosticTimers__getStateKL15TimerForDrivingCycle
Traceability
This function is given by architectural requirments: ??? AnMa ????: Description and SW architecture of requirements regarding "KL15 timer for driving cycle" (DCY = Driving CYcle) are completely missing in EA SW requirements are: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_793; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_791} It satisfies the following DOORS Requirements: {SWR_ICAS1_Diag_793; SWR_ICAS1_Diag_791}

briefdescription.para: The function getConditionVehicleSpeed just returns the validation status of vehicle speed processing which is verified cyclically (every 100 ms) Background: Some diagnosis services require preconditions to be fulfilled, in order to allow their execution.

detaileddescription.para:
One of the preconditions is that the velocity (vehicle speed) is within a certain range. This function returns the result of this velocity precondition check. Remark: Whether the preconditions shall be checked or not when receiving a diagnositc request depends on the State "OBD Driving Cycle" (see SWR_ICAS1_Diag_115)
N/A
N/A
void
ConditionVehicleSpeed - Result of the velocity precondition check done cyclically every 100 ms
PASSED
- Velocity preconditions are fulfilled
FAILED
- Velocity preconditions are NOT fulfilled

Test Method
This function can be verified using the following test method: Test if the function returns the value of the struct element "si_Status" from the static struct variable "VehicleSpeedValidation". TEST_DiagnosticTimers__getConditionVehicleSpeed

briefdescription.para: Implementation of diagnostic timers - NM_DiagActive, T_DiagEnable, KL15 timer for Driving Cycle validation.
